articles.title: Deutsche Bank beats profit expectations in fourth-quarter earnings - CNBC
articles.description: Deutsche Bank's net profit attributable to shareholders came in at 1.3 billion euros.

articles.title: Fed holds rates steady, signaling risks to economy are dropping - The Washington Post
articles.description: The central bank opted for its first pause after three rate cuts last year, as officials wait for clearer signs that inflation is cooling.

articles.title: Amazon’s AI push raises employee climate, layoff concerns - The Seattle Times
articles.description: Amid data center expansions and layoffs, concern is growing among Amazon employees over AI's climate impact.

articles.title: Microsoft’s Earnings Surge Is Overshadowed by Data-Center Spending - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Higher-than-anticipated capital spending and slower growth in cloud computing weigh on shares

articles.title: Tesla profits slumped 46% last year, as it lost its crown as the top EV seller - NPR
articles.description: The company announced it was ending production of its higher-end Model S and Model Y, and turning that production space over to making humanoid robots.

articles.title: Bessent touts Trump Accounts as rainy day fund and slams critics as "out of touch" - CBS News
articles.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent emphasized the benefits of Trump Accounts and addressed affordability concerns in an interview with CBS News.

articles.title: Zuckerberg teases agentic commerce tools and major AI rollout in 2026 - TechCrunch
articles.description: Mark Zuckerberg says 2026 will be "a big year for delivering personal super intelligence."

articles.title: IREN, Cipher Mining (CIFR) and Hut 8 (HUT) could be set to add to AI-related gains - CoinDesk
articles.description: In its fourth quarter earnings report, Meta said capital spending plans for 2026 should be in the range of $115-$135 billion, well ahead of consensus forecasts.

articles.title: World token jumps 27% as Sam Altman reportedly eyes a biometric social network to kill off bots - CoinDesk
articles.description: The WLD token surged after Forbes reported that Sam Altman's OpenAI is planning to use Worldcoin to fight bots online.

articles.title: Carvana Dives After Short Seller Criticizes Ties To Lenders - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Carvana stock fell about 20% on Wednesday after a short-seller report alleged the company's earnings depended on shaky loans.

articles.title: US stocks hold near their all-time high while the dollar’s value stabilizes - AP News
articles.description: Few ripples washed through Wall Street after the Federal Reserve decided to keep its main interest rate steady, just like investors expected. The U.S. stock and bond markets each remained at a virtual standstill on Wednesday, while the U.S. dollar stabilized …

articles.title: Lisa Cook lawsuit is ‘the most important legal case’ in Fed history, Powell says - Politico
articles.description: The central bank chief defended his decision to attend the Supreme Court argument on Trump's move to fire his Fed colleague.

articles.title: Tesla to invest $2B in Elon Musk’s xAI - TechCrunch
articles.description: Elon Musk's AI company xAI disclosed earlier this month it had raised $20 billion.

articles.title: Home Depot to cut 800 corporate jobs, require workers back to office full time - ajc.com
articles.description: Home Depot says it is eliminating about 800 corporate jobs tied to its Vinings headquarters.

articles.title: Starbucks scraps $250,000 cap on boss's use of company jet - BBC
articles.description: The coffee chain changes Brian Niccol's travel budget due to media attention and "credible threat actors".

articles.title: Target's incoming CEO addresses 'Minneapolis violence' in memo to employees - bringmethenews.com
articles.description: In a message to employees, the incoming CEO at Minneapolis-based Target called the two recent fatal shootings of residents by immigration agents “extremely painful.”   In a video message sent to workers on Monday and obtained by CNBC, Michael Fiddelke said “t…

articles.title: I Flew Southwest On Day One Of Assigned Seating — The Boarding Was A Mess And Bin Space Was Chaos - View from the Wing
articles.description: I didn’t plan to be a guinea pig for Southwest’s first day of assigned seating, but after American’s storm cancellations and operational meltdown I rebooked—and got a front-row seat to the new boarding reality. Seats may now be assigned, but the gate process …
